intro: Clidemia inopinata, commonly known as the Hawaiian strobilant, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often prostrate or ascending. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
